programme.title: Golf: PGA Championship
programme.desc: Action from day four of the Rolex Series event in the DP World Tour, held at Wentworth Club in Surrey. American Billy Horschel triumphed at this event for the second time in his career last year, having previously lifted the trophy in 2021. The event was decided in a three-way play-off, with Horschel edging out Northern Irelands Rory McIlroy and Thriston Lawrence of South Africa

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Highlights from the worlds biggest classical music festival, featuring performances by Anoushka Shankar, Pacho Flores, Liya Petrova, Nicholas McCarthy, Klaus Makela, Dalia Stasevska and Le Consort Ensemble and pieces by Vivaldi, Mendelssohn, Mahler, Vaughan Williams and Shostakovich

programme.title: Jessye Norman at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by American opera singer Jessye Norman, tracing her journey from spirituals and traditional folk songs to her landmark debut at the London Proms. Featuring interviews with the star across the decades

programme.title: Jessye Norman and the Spiritual
programme.desc: Soprano Jessye Norman presents a concert in speech and song in which she performs a selection of spiritual songs and explains their background and historical significance. Accompanied by pianist Philip Moll and the Ambrosian Singers, conducted by Willis Patterson. First broadcast in 1981

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Orchestral concert film, taking a journey along rivers around the world accompanied by music composed by Richard Tognetti and William Barton. Footage from different landscapes reveal how rivers have shaped the world, creating caverns, valleys and fertile plains, and revealing how they have shaped the history of human civilisation, and been affected by it in turn. Narrated by Willem Dafoe

programme.title: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes investigates the ideas of ancient philosophers, starting with the Indian nobleman Siddhartha Gautama, more popularly known as Buddha. Thought to have been lived and tought between the sixth and fourth centuries BC, the sage and holy man inspired a diverse belief system that influences the lives of millions of people to this day. She travels to India, where the Buddha experienced the challenging ideas and extreme methods of wandering truth seekers, after he had abandoned his family and homeland in the Himalayas to embark on his philosophical quest to find a solution to human suffering

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores Wales cultural history, beginning on Anglesey where he steps inside a prehistoric burial chamber to witness Welsh art in its earliest form. He also views an exquisite example of Bronze Age artistry in the shape of a gold cape, found by chance in a field in north Wales and now one of the prize exhibits in the British Museum

programme.title: Jessye Norman at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by American opera singer Jessye Norman, tracing her journey from spirituals and traditional folk songs to her landmark debut at the London Proms. Featuring interviews with the star across the decades

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Focusing on the relationships between animals and people living in some of the worlds most extraordinary natural wonders, this episode follows nomadic people from the Yamal Peninsula in northern Siberia, as they hunt one of the very few animals that can survive in this frozen environment, reindeer. Elsewhere, cameras observe a local ranger in the coastal salt marshes of Northern Australias Arnhem Land, as he goes in search of the eggs of one of the worlds most aggressive predators, the saltwater crocodile

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri visit Brighton Museum to investigate who painted two neglected pictures of religious subjects. Plus, Emma investigates how Brightons Royal Pavilion ended up an empty shell, ransacked and sold to the local council

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson presents as Frank Muir, Kate OMara, Godfrey Smith compete against Arthur Marshall, Victoria Wood and Tim Brooke-Taylor to earn points by identifying the correct definitions of obscure words. First broadcast in 1982

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Patricia Owen, Brian Redhead and John Julius Norwich. With guest musician James Galway. First broadcast in 1975

programme.title: Black and White in Colour: Television, Memory, Race, 1936-68
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary, first broadcast in 1992, that explores the contribution made by black and Asian people to British television between 1936 and 1968. Combining archive clips with stories of performers like Carmen Munroe and Cy Grant to ask if images on TV since have been portrayal or betrayal

programme.title: Black and White in Colour: Television, Memory, Race, 1936-68
programme.sub-title: Black and White in Colour: Television, Memory, Race, 1968-92
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part documentary tracing and questioning the progress made by black and Asian people on British television. Sitcoms such as Till Death Us Do Part gave work to black actors, but were audiences laughing with them or at them? First broadcast in 1992

programme.title: The Riviera: A History in Pictures
programme.desc: Richard E Grant concludes his exploration of the French Rivieras artistic legacy by focusing on how art and celebrity became intertwined in the early part of the 20th century. Resident artists such as Picasso and Matisse found the sun-drenched landscape ideal for experimenting with their work, and as the region became a creative hub, the likes of novelist Jean Cocteau and ballet impresario Sergei Diaghilev were drawn to the area. This artistic community also liked to party on the Cote dAzurs beaches - a pastime that proved equally irresistible to the American multimillionaires arriving in the area on board transatlantic liners

programme.title: An Art Lovers Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke explore the capital of Azerbaijan, which offers a mix of the ancient and modern in a country where cultural life is tightly controlled

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri visit Brighton Museum to investigate who painted two neglected pictures of religious subjects. Plus, Emma investigates how Brightons Royal Pavilion ended up an empty shell, ransacked and sold to the local council

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Focusing on the relationships between animals and people living in some of the worlds most extraordinary natural wonders, this episode follows nomadic people from the Yamal Peninsula in northern Siberia, as they hunt one of the very few animals that can survive in this frozen environment, reindeer. Elsewhere, cameras observe a local ranger in the coastal salt marshes of Northern Australias Arnhem Land, as he goes in search of the eggs of one of the worlds most aggressive predators, the saltwater crocodile

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Nottingham Forest at Emirates Stadium and West Ham United v Tottenham Hotspur at London Stadium. Arsenal claimed an impressive 3-0 victory over Forest when they hosted them last term, and the Hammers shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw with London rivals Spurs at home in the previous campaign. Plus, Bournemouth v Brighton and Hove Albion, Crystal Palace v Sunderland, Everton v Aston Villa, Fulham v Leeds United, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Brentford v Chelsea

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers looks at the political developments of the week and questions policy makers on the key issues

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.sub-title: St Johns Wood United Synagogue, London
programme.desc: Religious services from various faiths. The first episode comes from St Johns Wood United Synagogue in north London. Senior Rabbi Ivan Binstock welcomes viewers to an Orthodox Jewish morning prayer service, also known as Shacharit

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross is at the helm as the hunt for bargains heads to Lincoln. Providing the reds and blues a helping hand are experts Raj Bisram and Kate Bliss

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher travels to Chester to explore the deep meaning of the Sabbath and why the ancient teachings on the importance of rest are still so relevant today

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of the second session on day two of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. A new champion will be crowned in the mens 10,000m from 1.30, as three-time winner Joshua Cheptegei will not be defending his title, the fastest men and women in the world take to the track in the finals of the womens and mens 100m at 2.13 and 2.20 respectively, and medals will also be decided in the womens long jump from 12.40. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple from South London with a £500,000 budget to search for their dream home in the Devon countryside

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Live Womens Rugby World Cup 2025
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.00pm). Coverage of the fourth quarter-final, which takes place at Ashton Gate in Bristol. With analysis from Maggie Alphonsi and Simon Middleton, commentary by Sara Orchard and Katy Daley-McLean, and reports from Sonja McLaughlan

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker visit the Worcestershire village that provided the inspiration for The Archers, and continues to inspire storylines on the radio soap to this day. Plus, Datshiane Navanayagam delves into one of the countrysides most divisive issues - the tensions over second homes

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Shuttleworth House in Bedfordshire, where she delves into the history of the houses traction engine collection and gets to see one in action. She also finds out about 19th-century engineering industrialist Joseph Shuttleworth, who made his fortune from agricultural machinery. Items valued include diamond earrings, a lunar souvenir and an umbrella stand in the shape of a bear

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Manchester and discovers one of the most dilapidated clubs he has ever seen, with a clubhouse that is almost derelict and not enough players for even one team. He sets himself a deadline to get it back up and running by the end of the summer. In Blackpool, the girls team suffers a crisis of confidence when Freddie introduces the hard ball to training, then to make matters worse, theres a divide in the team

programme.title: King and Conqueror
programme.desc: Harold and Edith risk their lives to bargain with William but get a guarded reception. Harolds siblings face hardships trying to secure their familys future

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Kelly Cates presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Manchester City v Manchester United at Etihad Stadium and Burnley v Liverpool at Turf Moor. The Citizens were looking to avenge a 2-1 defeat at the hands of their local rivals in last seasons corresponding fixture, while champions Liverpool were looking to maintain their 100 per cent record so far this term against the newly promoted Clarets. Plus, a round-up of yesterdays goals

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest matches in the Super League, including West Ham United v Arsenal, Aston Villa v Chelsea and London City Lionesses v Manchester United

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening session on day three of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Emile Cairess is aiming to become the first British man to win a world marathon medal, with coverage starting five minutes after the race got under way. Also taking place is qualifying for the mens hammer and womens pole vault from 1.00 and 1.05 respectively, and the heats of the womens 3,000m steeplechase from 1.15 and 400m hurdles from 3.20. With commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: DNA on a shoelace links a man to a series of violent attacks at music venues. Plus, police crack a case by finding coded information in a spreadsheet that leads to a hacker

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Broadstairs, Kent, a favoured holiday destination of Charles Dickens to see a two-bedroom basement garden flat bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Burton-on-Trent, Staffordshire, where he sees a fire-damaged two-bed mid-terrace he first saw back in 2021. Hes also in Tonypandy, south Wales, to visit a four-storey building with potential to convert into separate flats. All three properties are then sold at auction and the successful bidders share their ambitions for their new acquisitions

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of the second session on day three of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The mens pole vault final continues and the 110m hurdles heats get under way at 12.20. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Mark Wright, Tommy Walsh and Maxine Dwyer help Helen and Matthew, who are facing a huge maintenance bill, transform their cluttered flat into a stylish home

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Star of the West End Joe McElderry joins Robson on a two-day trip into the wilds of Northumberland to relax the mind and recharge the body. The pair head first to a secluded lough to have a go at dragon paddle boarding, before heading to their farmland accommodation. Joe often holidayed on farms when he was younger, and he uses the skills he learnt as he and Robson have a go at trimming a prize-winning sheep

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a couple with four kids relocate to North Yorkshire, and meets a couple who have turned their passion for bee-keeping into a buzzing new life

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and Saf Fakir clear a Chesterfield bungalow of quirky collectibles, including a life-size statue of Jesus, cuckoo clocks, an Egyptian sarcophagus and puppets hanging from the ceiling. Owners Paula and Neil desperately need to reclaim space as their family is about to expand. However, the gang lose track of time during a cuckoo clock fix

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Stephen Mangan in the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe is still shaken by the shooting, but the police insist it wasnt a targeted attack. The Slaters welcome her home but she finds it too overwhelming and rushes out. Tensions rise between Okie and Harry, and Georges suspicions are raised. Kim considers driving again, Julie reveals shes got a new job at Walford High and Alfie offers Zack the role of chef at the Vic

programme.title: Paula McIntyres Hamely Kitchen
programme.desc: The food writer heads to New England, where she meets Brad McFadden, whose ancestors come from the same townland where she grew up. After sharing a home-cooked meal made by Brad, Paula visits a family run distillery to sample the latest fruit-based liqueurs. Her final stop is Macks Apple Farm, which is famous for its apple cider donuts. At her cabin on the Maine shoreline, Paula cooks a mushroom-stuffed potato farl and an apple dumpling coated in hazelnut and cinnamon

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Trump and Starmer: A Special Relationship? - Panorama
programme.desc: On the eve of President Trumps unprecedented second state visit to Britain, Jane Corbin looks at the state of the historic special relationship between the US and the UK. She visits Scotland, home to the presidents golf courses and birthplace of his mother, speaks to foreign secretary David Lammy about the risks and rewards of dealing with Donald Trump, and assesses how the prime minister is handling his powerful and unpredictable guest

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: Fran offers Ria an exciting promotion, but doubts set in when unsettling revelations come to light that call her motives into question

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.sub-title: True North: My Stammer, My Story
programme.desc: This edition follows three young people as they discover ways to manage their stammers. Viewers are introduced to Courtney and Nathan, both in their twenties, who are taking part in an intensive, peer-led course designed by and for people who stammer. Also, 17-year-old Lily-Rose, who has lived with a stammer since she could speak, reflects on how it has shaped her friendships, education, and sense of self

programme.title: Trying
programme.desc: Thirtysomething couple Jason and Nikki learn they will not be able to conceive a child together. When they learn that another round of IVF would be too expensive and unlikely to succeed, they start exploring adoption. Comedy drama, starring Rafe Spall and Esther Smith

programme.title: Trying
programme.desc: Aware that the adoption agency will conduct background checks, Nikki and Jason set about presenting themselves in the best possible light and attempt to make sure their contacts and referees are on the same page

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The time comes for one couple to flare out of Honeymoon Island, signalling the end of their relationship. On the other beaches, the couples swap partners for the day to gain some valuable insights into their marriages, resulting in some fiery exchanges on their return. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: An intimacy crate washes up to help the honeymooners get personal, and when the couples spend the day apart at beach picnics, some are left reeling from shocking revelations - before a new couple jump into stranded life together. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents coverage from day two of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The mens and womens 100m finals took centre-stage, as the fastest athletes in the world were crowned, and medals were also decided in the womens marathon, discus and long jump, and the mens 10,000m

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Delving into the not-so-easy lives of children throughout history, from the strict parenting of ancient civilisations, to the terrible fights the young King Louis XIV had with his little brother - even weeing on each others beds. And find out just why Henry VIII was so keen for his son Edward VI to stay inside

programme.title: Early Man
programme.desc: Young Dugs sheltered life with his Stone Age tribe is shattered by bronze-mining invaders led by greedy Lord Nooth. To win his home back, desperate Dug gambles on challenging these more sophisticated folk in a contest they love, but he only knows from rock paintings - football. Director Nick Parks animated adventure, with the voices of Eddie Redmayne, Timothy Spall, Rob Brydon, Miriam Margolyes and Johnny Vegas

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The time comes for one couple to flare out of Honeymoon Island, signalling the end of their relationship. programme.desc: An intimacy crate washes up to help the honeymooners get personal, and when the couples spend the day apart at beach picnics, some are left reeling from shocking revelations - before a new couple jump into stranded life together. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: A crate containing the couples mobile phones washes ashore, revealing more than anyone bargained for. David drops a bombshell to Ini, causing shockwaves at the Couples Cove. And when night falls, a movie serves up some even bigger surprises for the honeymooners. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers the dark side of Thailands backpacker culture. In the first episode, she lands in trouble with the Thai police when she starts to uncover the scale of Thailands illegal sex industry. A visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets men chasing cheap thrills in Asias sex capital, Pattaya, and also talks to a local sex worker, who reveals the harsh reality of working in the illegal sex industry. She then heads to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty. For Zara, this is paradise - but Lucio, a Brit who built a burgeoning cannabis business here while the drug was decriminalised, reveals that navigating the local law isnt always easy

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: I Cannae Cos the Child Locks On
programme.desc: Sammyjo enlists the Longlox girls help as she makes plans for her and Garys first anniversary, while Carmen wants to pierce below the waist. After Nathans third weigh-in, the Bilton Boys head off for a nights camping

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Jonny gets a new job and a sexy offer he cant refuse. Gaz and Donna have trouble sleeping, while David shows Louise how to cope with growing old. Comedy, starring Ralf Little and Will Mellor

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott explores the islands economy, with access to luxury clubs, yachts and villas, as well as the local police, undercover detectives and emergency medics. In the first episode, she meets Wayne Lineker, Garys little brother who has made it rich by providing clubbers with a day club pool party

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day three of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Reigning champion Armand Duplantis was among the athletes to watch as he looked to win yet another pole vault title, and Emile Cairess was aiming to become the first British man to win a world marathon medal

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Super-rich Roman politician Crassus raps about his blinging lifestyle, some unusual soldiers are recruited into the Second World War, and Johannes Gutenberg goes head to head with some monks on The Historical Apprentice

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machines crash-test before handing it over to the Stigs environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom/The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep
programme.desc: Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

Mushpot warns him not to take it though.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: ...Bears Dream/Manufacturing Secret/Bling Bling Bear/Intellectual Bear/Voodoo Blanket/Bear Prints/Inspector Grizzy => A she-bear is impressed by the Lemmings Kapla construction. / The Lemmings draw inspiration from a martial arts book and start breaking every wooden object they can get their hands on. / Grizzy dreams hes a knight who has delivered his beloved. / Grizzy stands in front of the pantry, desperate. The stock of chocolate spread is completely depleted. He realizes that the Lemmings are making some themselves! / Inspired by a jewelry ad showing a man offering a diamond to a woman, Grizzy imagines himself offering the rangers engagement ring to his she-bear. / When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his temple, Grizzy is transformed into an exceptionally intelligent being. / The Lemmings prepare a dream afternoon snack with the last jar of chocolate spread in the cupboard. Tough luck Grizzy is coming! / Grizzy finds he can print images from the rangers camera. / A crate of jars of chocolate spread is delivered.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Seepod/The Disappearing Mushler/Bouncing Back/Morel in the Dark/Save The Fun Tree
programme.desc: Chep has come across a new seedpod specimen. Mushpot warns him not to take it though. / Mush-Mush can’t wait to show his tricks of forest illusion to everyone. / Mush-Mush is very proud he invented a new game called Fruity Bounce, where he and his friends bounce as high as possible on the bouncier fruits they can find. / When Mush-Mush discovers that Morel is afraid of the dark, he suggests that Chep, Lilit and he take the Mushlets to their first overnight forest camp / Mush-Mush and friends’ favourite play tree is rotten and doomed. Our friends, track down Starmush, hoping his powers can save it.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Run, Mushpie, Run/Puffs Perfect Picnic/Good Vibrations/Getting Truffy With It
programme.desc: Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Lilit is under pressure. Truff, the most talented musician in Mushton, has invited her, Mush-Mush and Chep to form a band with him. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush.

programme.sub-title: Three Gentlemen of Moletown/Who Arted/Trash Trash Trash!/Magic Rectangle/Guacamoley
programme.desc: When Moley’s Keeper duties are pulling him in too many directions, he gets Manny to create multiple Moleys! / When Dotty joins an art competition Moley is afraid her art won’t appeal to the snooty judge so he casts a spell that causes her art to come to life! / When Manny accidentally transports a heap of trash into Moletown, Moley attempts to recycle it by fixing up the town. / When a cell phone falls into Roley Poley park from the Great Above, the entire town is mesmerized by it and Moley must break the “spell” it has on them. / When Moley gets in over his head when he enters a spicy chile eating contest, Manny accidentally makes the chile come alive!

programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Theo, River, Arthur, Reece, Luna and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has got a blue bib and blue sunglasses inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different blue toys and objects in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate blue object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The traditional nursery rhyme Little Boy Blue features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger dressing up in blue things, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring the colour blue too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory scarves and the Goodbye Song.

They then embark on a forest-bathing workshop, attempting a series of exercises to reawaken their senses. Day two starts with a homage to Mozart. programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Using the famous Caesars Palace as her base, Jane shows there is more to Las Vegas than the casinos. programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald

programme.title: Live Cricket
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Coverage of the third and final T20 of the series from Trent Bridge, Nottingham. The teams have not met here in this format since 2009, when South Africa claimed a seven-wicket victory during the ICC World Twenty20. In more recent times, England have won just one of their last three T20s here, winning against India either side of defeats at the hands of Pakistan and New Zealand

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night
programme.desc: Miami Dolphins v New England Patriots. Coverage of the week two match between the AFC East teams, held at Hard Rock Stadium, joining in progress 30 minutes after kick-off. Both teams missed out on the play-offs last season, with the Dolphins finishing second in the division, but some distance behind Buffalo Bills, with an 8-9 record, and the Patriots ending the campaign with just four wins all season. Both meetings between the teams in the previous campaign saw Miami prevail, winning 15-10 at Gillette Stadium and 34-15 here. Tonights coverage will also feature the game within a game quiz element, whenever the NFL game stops in the US

programme.title: Rich Holiday, Poor Holiday

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples in and around Cambridge compete for the cash prize of £1,000, with Fiona and Anthony kicking off proceedings with a carnival-style dinner party. Everyone loves the chicken wings starter, but the spicy fish main proves too much for electrician Paul, and his wife Karen thinks that international couple Ari and Amanda seem a bit posh. On day two, a squeamish Karen nearly throws up as Paul prepares chicken liver pâte, while Ari and Amanda get the wrong end of the stick when they turn up in Christmas jumpers. Finally, Ari and Amanda plan to impress with an evening of fine dining, and their guests are instantly impressed by the size of their house

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

On day two Georgie and Alex cook up recipes devised by Alexs mother. Finally, Paul and Gareth plan an Italian menu. Using crystals and visualisation techniques, they endeavour to serve their duck breast medium rare and hope that their mousse is fluffy. However, things fail to go to plan

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partners parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jacks Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chefs advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah and Masons, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willys Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. programme.desc: George Sr accidentally puts the school librarian in hospital, so the Coopers nurse her back to health. Meemaw gives Georgie relationship advice

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After a sleepless night, Leonard breaks his room-mate agreement with Sheldon. Howard makes preparations to go on a flight to the International Space Station and enlists Rajs help to ensure he gets a cool astronaut nickname

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon uses his holidays to help Amy in her biology lab, but moans about the menial jobs he is given - until she asks him to dissect a brain. Penny grows curious about Leonards attitude to marriage when Bernadette asks Howard to sign a pre-nuptial agreement

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: With the children behaving boisterously, Claire and Phil threaten to cancel their Christmas celebrations, and Lily is taken to see Santa. Starring Julie Bowen and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mannys biological father visits, and Jays reaction to him lands him in trouble with Gloria. Meanwhile, Claire relies on a fireman to get Phil to the hospital for kidney stone treatment and Lily is sleep-trained by her doting dads. Starring Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. Elsewhere, Raj feels lonely while his best friend is away and ends up interfering with Sheldons and Leonards dates. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. Meanwhile, on the International Space Station, Howard is being bullied by the other astronauts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part three of three. The team at the precinct go on a road trip to help Peralta and Holt take down crime boss Jimmy The Butcher Figgis, but the plan is hindered by an unforeseen injury and an interruption by Sheriff Reynolds. In the middle of the chaos, Santiago and Peralta share an awkward reunion

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: In a New Girl crossover episode, Peralta runs into Jess Day, who is visiting New York from Los Angeles, and enlists her help on his latest case. Holt looks for ways to improve the teams morale as they come to terms with being on the night shift, while Santiago is filled with curiosity when Diaz starts to take long breaks from her desk. Zooey Deschanel (New Girl) and Matt Walsh (Veep) guest star

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: An irreverent take on the Prince and the Pauper. Bart enthusiastically trades lives with wealthy lookalike Simon Woosterfield after landing himself in trouble. Simon settles into life at home with the Simpsons, but Bart finds the lavish lifestyle too much to handle when he becomes the target of all his new friends pranks

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Marge remember the ups and downs of their marriage through a series of flashbacks, including the time they each began flirting with guests at a glamorous party - a situation that led to a food fight and an unexpected swim in the pool

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette and Howard host a dinner party, but as it falls on Sheldons Thai food night, he opts to bring his own dinner. As punishment for his lack of manners, the gang decides he should organise Wolowitzs cluttered wardrobe, but he discovers an unopened letter from Howards father, who hasnt made contact in years

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. However, the panel includes Mrs Davis from Human Resources, whom Sheldon has crossed paths with before. Guest starring Regina King

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. Raj discovers his new girlfriend Lucy has a blog in which she has written about him, and is upset when he learns she believes he has feminine qualities, causing him to worry about their relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon discover their favourite childhood TV science show host Professor Proton can be booked for private parties and decide to hire him to entertain them. Meanwhile, Raja asks Howard and Bernard to look after his dog for the weekend, but the couple panic when the canine goes missing. Guest starring Bob Newark

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Apu becomes the proud father of octuplets and enjoys being showered with free gifts from companies that want him to endorse their products - until a couple in nearby Shelbyville go one better by having nine children. Cartoon capers, featuring the voice of former Munsters actor Butch Patrick

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer wins a vintage motorcycle and forms his own gang - only to encounter trouble in the form of tough bikers the Hells Satans, who kidnap Marge. Featuring the voices of John Goodman and Henry Winkler

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Leela worries about Ste when he doesnt come home, while Dillon jumps to conclusions. Elsewhere, Jez plans a memorial for Sienna

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.sub-title: Married at First Sight UK: Reunion Special
programme.desc: Fan favourites from the class of 2023 and 2024 reunite for a cosy country dinner party reunion that theyll never forget. With some of them coming together for the first time since leaving the experiment, the brides and grooms share their thoughts on what went down, where they are in their lives right now and their wishes for the future. Plus, the infamous Honesty Box causes a stir among the group

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Tristan and Jules are happier than ever as the gang touch down on the coast of Thailand, but the shock news that Tristans ex Molly is there at the same time irks Jules. After a tricky break-up, Freddy and Beks find themselves on holiday together, but luckily for Beks, her ex Chuggs is there too. Back in London, Jack and Livvy both admit that their relationship has hit a rough patch

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Mariah Careys Magical Christmas Special, Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Coronation Street, Swamp People: Serpent Invasion, Nigellas Cook, Eat, Repeat, Tiny World, news coverage of the Brexit stalemate and the Covid vaccine. They also comment on Health Secretary Matt Hancocks recent TV appearances

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: The Traitors 2023 finalist, Aaron, enters the restaurant looking for love and ends up paired with straight-A student Laura. Krissy returns to the dating scene for the first time after becoming a first-time mum at age 51 and ends up paired with chauffeur-to-the-stars, Rob. British Sign Language user Shaun is hoping his Mr Bean impression will impress party-loving Carly and Retail assistant Neil roller-skates into the restaurant looking for someone who accepts him just the way he is

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Captain Kerry Titheradge takes control of the 197-foot motor yacht St David as he leads his crew off the rich, historical island of Grenada. As he steps onto St David for the first time, Captain Kerry relies on returning crew members, chief stew Fraser Olender and lead deckhand Ben Willoughby, to help the new staff find their way around the massive vessel. The conflict on the exterior looms large, while the heat in the galley is daunting. With new faces everywhere, romance is in the air, but will the challenges of a new crew and new roles prove too much for the St David?

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: An Academic Crime and a More Romantic Taco Bell
programme.desc: Dr Sturgis is furious when Sheldon accuses him of plagiarism. Mary sets out to find a suitable girl trophy for Missys end-of-season baseball ceremony, and Georgie has an awkward run-in with Veronica while on a date with new girlfriend Jana

programme.title: Africa from Above

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: Follow the Volta River from the Sahel savannahs of the North, through fertile cocoa-laden hills at the heart of the nation, and across the biggest man-made lake in Africa

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: Head to the most populous landlocked country on Earth to view Lake Tana, Ethiopias largest lake, and the Great Green Wall, to see communities fighting desertification

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: Discover the rich biodiversity of the Pearl of Africa, where spectacular landscapes include the glacier-tipped Rwenzori mountains, ancient rainforests and crater lakes

programme.desc: Morocco is the gateway to Africa, and this epic adventure explores the Mediterranean coastline, the mighty Atlas mountains and the seemingly endless Sahara

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: June, a science-loving little girl, and her mother spend hours playing with stuffed animals and other toys, fashioning a world of imagination connected to a fabulous theme park. When Junes mom is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness and has to go away for treatment, June finds a real version of her theme park. Animated family adventure, with the voices of Mila Kunis, Jennifer Garner and Kenan Thompson

programme.title: The Personal History of David Copperfield Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens beloved novel to the screen

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder, and determined to save others suffering his same fate, biochemist Dr Michael Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. However, what at first appears to be a radical success soon reveals itself to be a remedy potentially worse than the disease, when he develops a form of vampirism. Comic-book adventure, starring Jared Leto, Matt Smith, Adria Arjona and Jared Harris

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: A cops career is seemingly over when he accidentally shoots a hostage while thwarting a bank robbery. He is given the chance to redeem himself by joining an elite unit headed by a veteran sergeant. Their mission is to escort an international crime lord in custody as he is taken to prison. However, they hit a snag when their prisoner offers a multimillion-dollar reward to anyone who breaks him out of jail, placing them under attack from every criminal in the city. Action thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson and Colin Farrell

programme.title: Capernaum
programme.desc: In Beirut, Zain is a young boy of uncertain age who is in prison for stabbing someone. He is also suing his parents for neglect. Writer/director Nadine Labakis Cannes Jury prize-winning, Oscar-nominated drama, starring Zain Al Rafeea. In Arabic and Amharic, with English subtitles

programme.title: Outcast of the Islands
programme.desc: A clerk in a South Seas trading post is sacked after being accused of stealing. After faking his suicide, he reacquaints himself with the trading ship captain who befriended him as a 12-year-old boy. The seafarer agrees to help him regain his reputation, but his trust is soon exploited. Drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Trevor Howard

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: Notorious pirate Henry Morgan is made governor of Jamaica, and offers other buccaneers the choice of giving up their lawless ways or facing justice. Two rogues refuse to toe the line, so Morgans trusted ally James Waring is sent to track them down, but has other things on his mind - namely winning the daughter of the previous governor away from her duplicitous fiance. High-seas adventure, with Tyrone Power, Laird Cregar, George Sanders, Maureen OHara and Anthony Quinn

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: A woman raises her six-year-old daughter to believe that Santa Claus does not exist, but they both have a change of heart after meeting a department store Father Christmas who claims to be the man himself. When the kindly fellow is accused of being a charlatan, his new friends engage a lawyer to prove his true identity. Remake of the 1947 family drama, with Richard Attenborough, Elizabeth Perkins, Mara Wilson and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Fishermans Friends
programme.desc: A music executive heads out to a Cornish fishing village on a mission to recruit a group of 10 local fishermen into recording an album of sea shanties. He struggles to win over the unlikely boy band and their families, but begins to gain a new appreciation for their traditional values. Comedy, starring James Purefoy, Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton

programme.title: Memory
programme.desc: Veteran hitman Alex Lewis decides to retire as he confronts the symptoms of Alzheimers, which has already reduced his brother Bill to a catatonic state in a nursing home. He reluctantly accepts one final job, to kill a lawyer in possession of an incriminating flash drive - but finds the mission violates his code. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Guy Pearce and Monica Bellucci

programme.title: The Rhythm Section
programme.desc: After a tragic plane crash kills her family, Stephanie Patrick heads down a path of self-destruction When she discovers it wasnt an accident, Stephanie turns to a former CIA operative who can help her find the culprits. But her quest to uncover the truth soon turns into a full-blown quest for revenge as Patrick decides to punish those responsible. Drama, starring Blake Lively, Jude Law and Matilda Ziegler

programme.title: The Big Man
programme.desc: An out-of-work miner in a Scottish town ravaged by unemployment is forced to turn to illegal bare-knuckle boxing to make ends meet. However, he soon realises the fighting game is corrupt and linked to a conflict between rival Glasgow drug gangs. Drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ian Bannen, Joanne Whalley, Billy Connolly and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Von Ryans Express
programme.desc: A courageous American colonel with a never-say-die attitude is held in a PoW camp. He boldly sets out to lead a group of Allied prisoners in a daring mass escape bid by hijacking a freight train and fleeing through occupied Italy to Switzerland. Second World War action adventure, starring Frank Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Brad Dexter and James Brolin

programme.desc: A veteran Union officer crosses paths again with a former Confederate enemy years after the end of the Civil War - and their past animosity resurfaces. Action thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Michael Pena and Danny Glover

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: The discovery of a womans body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. Delving into the victims electronic organiser, he learns she was connected with a local religious community - and realises someone in the congregation is more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: Beautiful Russian aristocrat Countess Vera Rossakoff, the chief suspect in a series of jewel thefts, seemingly captivates Poirot with her charm and intellect, meaning Hastings and Miss Lemon have to do most of the actual detective work and ensure she is brought to justice. Drama, guest starring Kika Markham

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse suspects a connection between a womans disappearance and her past employer, but another missing persons case demands his attention in the form of a notable artist, whose work adorns the covers of a series of paperback mysteries. Meanwhile, reports flood in of stolen cars and wanton criminal damage, as a debauched group of university undergraduates wreak havoc, while the murder of a uniformed officer sees Bright order all hands on deck at Castle Gate. Much to Morse and Thursdays chagrin, the cast of TV detective show Jolly for Short is in town filming the final series

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Pop plans to build a swimming pool in the shape of Ma for her birthday surprise, while Charley and Mariette take a well-earned break in France. Starring David Jason and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Roger returns to Liverpool, while Pop discovers Ediths new boyfriend George is a con-artist defrauding the ministry - and resolves to teach him a lesson. David Jason stars

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth helps an old friend find refuge at country house Greenshaws Folly, but a sinister shadow falls over the strange buildings various inhabitants and a murderer strikes. Miss Marple uncovers secrets from the past about Miss Greenshaw as a dangerous storm gathers and the bodies start to pile up. Julia McKenzie heads an all-star cast that includes Jim Moir (better known as Vic Reeves), Kimberley Nixon, Fiona Shaw, Robert Glenister, Julia Sawalha, Judy Parfitt and Matt Willis (formerly of pop group Busted)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A murder at a remote cottage in Northumberland takes DCI Vera Stanhope back to a place full of childhood memories and reminds her of an unsolved case from earlier in her career. Delving into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a quarry, she and her team find motives in the unlikeliest of places - until they realise that the truth could be hidden within the land itself. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves novel The Crow Trap, guest starring Daniela Nardini (This Life) alongside Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.sub-title: How Long Has This Been Going On?
programme.desc: Morwenna is back as receptionist and the Ellinghams have a new dog. Martin attends Stewarts survival course, but not as a participant like Al and Penhale. Louisa agrees to help Pippa by speaking at the school assembly alongside Mrs Tishell. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Martin rubs up against the new herbalist and Penhale, Louisa and James are all interested in Janices new pedicure fish. Martins ex-flame invites him to speak as keynote speaker at Imperial College, and Ruth is back from Mexico with more than maracas

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fishermans body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawlers net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead mans sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead mans steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead mans sister-in-law goes up in flames

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: In 1989, Ann Ming is distraught when her 22-year-old daughter Julie Hogg goes missing, but the police shrug off her concerns, suggesting that she must have fled to London to reunite with her estranged husband. Knowing in her heart that Julie would never leave her brother Kevin behind, Ann uncovers a mothers worst nightmare. Fact-based drama, starring Sheridan Smith

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of her daughters body, Ann channels her grief into putting pressure on the police for answers, while also battling to save her marriage from crumbling under the strain. Anns hopes of getting justice are boosted when a local man is arrested, but the accused seems to be scrutinised less than Julie when it comes to the trial and the bungled investigation leads to an unthinkably awful outcome

programme.desc: Ken pays a visit to old flame Denise and tells her he wants to meet his son Daniel. Whether the straight-talking hairdresser will agree is a different matter.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Leanne finally agrees to go out for a drink with Liam after shes finished seeing her new client. However, shes in for a big shock when she meets the punter in question.

programme.desc: News of Martin and Louisas engagement spreads rapidly through the village, and Aunt Joan is annoyed to hear about it from Dave rather than her nephew. Comedy drama series, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor and Louisa make plans for their wedding, but the big day runs far from smoothly, as a drunken vicar leaves Martin with a dilemma. Meanwhile, the restaurant where the reception is to be held is flooded and Isobel goes into labour. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill and Gordons wedding day finally arrives, but a huge explosion at a nearby care home disrupts proceedings in spectacular fashion. As the Royal staff help pull the elderly residents out of the rubble, the horrifying truth about the cause of the accident is discovered. Starring Amy Robbins, Robert Daws and Paul Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina tries to kick-start her singing career by performing at a local nightclub, only to find herself accused of possessing drugs - which she suspects were planted in her handbag. Elsewhere, David responds to an unexpected windfall by making a very bad investment. Rural drama, starring Tricia Penrose and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Having dabbled in just about everything else under the sun, Greengrass develops a sudden interest in archaeology, convinced Aidensfield is full of buried treasures just waiting to be discovered. Unfortunately for him, the first items unearthed prove to be human remains, leading to fears that there is a murderer at large. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Perdy tells Grayson that Rosemary lied about his fathers death, before violently attacking her mother-in-law. Terry knocks Duke to the ground during an argument.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matthew tells Perdy the only way to escape hospital and get her life back is to pretend shes ill, while Andy is persuaded to give the goats a stay of execution.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul struggles to keep his mouth shut about his unexpected encounter with Leanne, while Ken sets off to meet Daniel - unaware hes being followed by Blanche - and Liz sets up a secret rendezvous with Derek.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul urges Liam to get rid of Leanne, so she hits back with a threat to the factory boss - if he says any more, shell tell Carla what he was up to the night before.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Since calling off his marriage to Louisa, Martin has begun to question what keeps him in Cornwall and realises that if he is ever to escape, he must conquer the blood phobia that ended his surgical career. Encouraged by aunt Joans friend Barbara he tackles his fear, but after an accident the pair end up in hospital, where he bumps into his girlfriend from medical school. Later, the return of a familiar face shakes him up even more. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Lia Williams

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Despite the doctors unpleasant attitude toward her, Louisa applies for a job at the school - where she quickly notices something strange about the new headmasters behaviour. Martin refers Paulines aunt and uncle to Edith after they have trouble conceiving a baby, but her tests lead one of the couple to make a surprising confession. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with David Haig

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A couple who have recently returned to Aidensfield from Africa accuse their housekeeper of stealing, but Blaketon is more concerned about protecting their son from bullies. Meanwhile, Greengrass has a porker of a problem on his hands thanks to David, who accidentally buys some pigs at an auction on his behalf. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie refuses to believe her uncle could be responsible for a hit-and-run incident, despite the weight of evidence against him - a situation which puts her relationship with Mike to the test. Elsewhere, life in Aidensfield carries on much as normal, as Greengrasss greed causes a funeral to be a total wash-out. Rural drama, with Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Grace
programme.desc: The team investigates a case where nothing is ever as it first appears as an unidentified murder victim is found left out in the open countryside in curious circumstances. The post-mortem reveals more questions than it does answers, and as Grace works to identify the body, a chilling discovery in central Brighton suggests that a brazen killer is orchestrating an elaborate quest for vengeance

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sam is suspended from duty and decides to spend some time with his son, while Brooks and Leyton make a breakthrough when they discover who was responsible for the train crash and put the culprit under surveillance. Jake and Kate argue over whether it was right to prosecute Finn Tyler in his fragile mental state. Drama, starring Paul Nicholls and Bradley Walsh

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the childs grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty)

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam lead the investigation into the death of a wealthy woman whose body was dumped in the Thames. The team initially focuses inquiries on the victims abusive ex-husband, with whom she had been involved in a bitter struggle over custody of their daughter Holly, but the case heads in a different direction when the detectives discover the teenager was infatuated with her mothers new partner. With Patrick Baladi and an appearance by Bradley Walshs son Barney

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Will Theos real parents want him back or will the couples be able to sort things out amicably? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: Surgeons: Life in Their Hands
programme.desc: Australian fly-on-the-wall series following patients and staff at the Royal Prince Alfred Hospital in Sydney. Cardiac ICU nurse Elio works his last shift before he goes from staff member to patient, putting his faith in his friends and colleagues as he undergoes surgery for a leaky heart valve. Meanwhile, a patient has badly dislocated and broken his ankle after being thrown across a room while filming a music video

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The emergency room documentary continues, highlighting the stories of people facing adversity head-on. Erin, a 61-year-old former cancer patient with an ear infection, is rushed to St Georges Hospital after she collapsed at home. Doctors fear the condition may have spread to her brain, and send her for a CT scan to find out more. Tony, a 70-year-old part-time DJ, arrives in AandE after being involved in a high-speed bicycle accident while training for a 100-mile charity bike ride, and Charlie, a 39-year-old cabin crew worker, turns up at the hospital complaining of unbearable pain after discharging himself during a previous visit, and removing the cast fitted to support his broken arm

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The documentary detailing the daily work of staff at St Georges Hospital in south-west London continues, this time highlighting the stories of patients who received support from loved ones when life became tough. Gerald, a 66-year-old lifeguard and polo club official is rushed into AandE, having sustained a serious head wound after a 10-foot fall. The friends and family of 55-year-old Beverly gather at the hospital when she is admitted with a broken leg after being hit by a car near her home, and Paul, a 39-year-old father-of-three, arrives in resus with a nasty cut to his right arm. Paul complains that he is unable to move his fingers, leading staff to believe be may have significant tendon or nerve damage that could leave him permanently unable to use his hand

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

In Kidderminster, a woman is suffering withdrawal symptoms from the effects of alcohol. She rang 999 from her bedroom without telling her family. Its a surprise for everyone when an emergency ambulance crew knocks on the door. Paramedics also attend a 10-year-old girl who is complaining of chest pains whos also taking medication for psychosis

At breakfast, tensions simmer as Wendy calls Cameron a creep, and at feedback, some of the comments send Erika and Ellie into fits of giggles

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on Andys Ford Pop hot rod, a 1950s car thats jam-packed with modifications - all of which, sadly, are bent, broken or riddled with rust

programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend fix up one of the most iconic cars to come out of Germany, a BMW E30 Alpina. Its Mazs pride and joy but his ill health has prevented him from getting it back on the road

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil help househunters in Edinburgh. Phil meets Freya and Elliot who are moving from Aberdeen to the capital for the cultural buzz. Kirstie helps Edinburgh lass Sadia and Irishman Sohail find their first family home so they can finally move out of Sadias starter flat

Roping in his wife Carol, daughter Abby and a selection of favoured workmates, Paul and his team begin work on the ultra-modern, five-bedroom build, and Kevin McCloud reveals how extreme weather, exhaustion, and rapidly dwindling funds place the entire project in jeopardy

programme.title: Our Welsh Chapel Dream

Marj restores a baroque French chair, while fellow Pottery Throw Down judge Rich Miller helps Keith to make brutalist tiles for a feature wall. programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Peggy, 85, arrives at the hospital by ambulance, having injured her knee at home. Meanwhile, the team keeps a close eye on 75-year-old Bob, who has had a suspected heart attack, and Ben, 25, isnt overly concerned by his swollen finger, until a doctor diagnoses cellulitis

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Staff nurse Graeme is attacked by a prisoner who has been brought to Kings College Hospital for treatment and the team has to restrain the patient before giving him the care he needs. programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: My Dream Derelict Home in the Sun

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: YouTube star Joe Sugg uncovers some incredible stories in his family tree, with a little help along the way from big sister and fellow social media influencer Zoe. Very aptly, Joe discovers a great-great-great grandfather who was involved in the earliest days of communication technology - in electrical telegraphs. Pushing further back, he finds seven-times-great grandparents who fled religious persecution in France and a goldsmith who survived the Great Fire of London

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Star of stage and screen Judi Dench sets out to research her ancestry, beginning with her father Reginald Dench. He never spoke of his experiences during the First World War, so she tries to find out how he won his gallantry medals. Judis investigations then take a truly epic turn, leading her to 16th-century Denmark and nobility. The actress also discovers, to her delight, some remarkable Shakespearean links

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the story of reunited siblings Geoffrey Tonks and Barbara Jacobs as they investigate a family mystery and try to trace a missing sister on Geoffreys fathers side. They also catch up with Robert Lindsay, who explores the difficulties of building a father/son relationship so late in life, and brother and sister Nicholas Rhoades and Cayley Cox talk about how they have already experienced an enormous amount together in the year that has passed since they met for the first time

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of three men brought up in the care system who are trying to reconnect with the families that were taken from them. Murray Phillips was adopted from a childrens home as a young boy with his older brother Ricky, who was sent back to the childrens home when he was 12, leaving nine-year-old Murray completely devastated and confused. Eighty-seven-year-old Mark Chesterfield spent a large part of his childhood at a foundling hospital and has been trying to reclaim his identity ever since he found out at the age of 74 that he wasnt an orphan, as hed always believed, but had a mother whod wanted to be part of his life. Having traced her side of the family, he came to Long Lost Family to find out about his fathers side

He ends his stay at the Ritz-Carlton, home to the worlds highest swimming pool

programme.desc: Elsie gets closer to uncovering the truth about Delos, and Dolores calculates her next move. Meanwhile, Maeve continues to search for her daughter

programme.title: Westworld
programme.desc: Maeve is faced with a scene from her past, and Bernard meets an unexpected old friend. Elsewhere, the Cradle comes under threat

programme.title: Westworld

programme.title: Westworld

programme.title: Westworld

programme.title: Game of Thrones

On a journey that takes in an 18th-century pleasure house and a burlesque life-painting class, Alan also stops off in Temple Bar for a pint with singer Sharon Corr, unlocks a mystery in Irelands oldest library and uncovers a stylish secret that lurks behind the steel shutters of an old lock-up

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets

programme.title: The Guest Wing

The programme explores how the reality of life in Britains grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle

When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the sham marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris

programme.desc: A middle-aged shop worker reveals he has never been intimate with a woman, which prompts his shocked colleagues to set him up with a series of potentially passionate dates. When he falls for a single mother, his friends think he is right on course for a lusty liaison, but his new partner is not ready for a physical relationship. Judd Apatows comedy, starring Steve Carell, Catherine Keener and Paul Rudd

Comedy adventure, starring Michael Cera, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Jason Schwartzman
