programme.desc: A newborn baby has breathing problems, paramedics treat an elderly lady whos fallen and hit her head, and crewmates investigate the worrying symptoms of a potential stroke victim

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics help a patient who fears hes having his third heart attack, and an elderly woman who had a fall at home and may have been lying on the floor all night

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics need to get a sick baby to hospital. They also treat a man who suffers from epilepsy and an elderly lady who needs to take her medication

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nigel has keyhole surgery to repair his hernia - but things go wrong when hes back on the ward. Carol has a pin removed from her ankle, which was previously fractured

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over
programme.desc: Stacey meets single mum-of-eight Marie Buchan, a lightning rod in the fierce debate over the UK benefits system who has openly shared her state-funded lifestyle

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A mayday call from a yacht triggers a search and rescue operation involving multiple agencies including the Air Force and the Auckland Rescue Helicopter team

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A huge team of volunteers from across the South Island gathers on the West Coast to search for a Swedish national who went hunting in the Karangarua Valley area but never returned

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr transform the courtyard into a Mediterranean oasis. To brush up on their botany, the pair visit the magnificent gardens of one of Sicilys biggest wine producers, where they help out with the grape harvest. Keen to create an authentic Sicilian design, Alan explores Sciaccas famous ceramic scene and gets arty painting Moor Heads. He also enlists the help of two baroque-style painters to bring a touch of the islands rich history with a surprise courtyard centrepiece. Amanda repairs the old courtyard walls, which turns out to be a far bigger job than anticipated

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary turns its attention away from Liverpools mothers-to-be, instead focusing on the roles the various boyfriends, fiances, partners and husbands play in the labour suite. Super-organised Paul, a risk manager by trade, impresses midwives when he plans out every detail of his wife Nadine birthing experience, right down to the music. Meanwhile, young parents-to-be Bobbilee and Frankie, who had only known each other for a month before Bobbi became pregnant, have a much more laissez-faire attitude to labour, one which is put to the ultimate test after 48 hours at the Womens Hospital. Finally, 32-year-old mum Linda faces bringing her baby into the world without the aid of her partner Tony, whose traumatic past experience of hospitals means he wont be accompanying her to theatre

programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Warrington, Cheshire, to meet electrician Dave McCartney, a healthy man until he had a stroke at work that has left him partially paralysed. programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick tries to save a tortoiseshell cats leg by cutting out a tumour that has developed and replacing its knee with a unique bionic implant. Staffordshire bull terrier Rosie is admitted as an emergency after her back legs suddenly collapse in the park, and Noel performs essential spinal surgery to the diseased discs in Rosies spine and advises a course of intense physiotherapy

programme.title: Dog School
programme.desc: A peek behind the fence at Bruces Doggy Day Care in Surrey and Dogs Country Club in Warrington, where dogs take part in activities from Doga to aromatherapy massage and good doggy football. Minnie the Rottweiler arrives at Dogs Country Club in Warrington, but needs to have her behaviour assessed by Zeus the Siberian Husky, who can spot an antisocial dog within minutes

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A woman gets caught on the wrong end of a fishing spear, theres a daring rescue at sea and a chopper crew welcomes a new life mid-flight

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers fly solo this week, giving them a chance to demonstrate their individual abilities as they transform shepherd huts into boutique boltholes on a glampsite in north Wales. The client is a brand-new business so they have a blank canvas to work on, and having been given individual briefs by Michelle Ogundehin, each designer takes a different approach to turning these tiny spaces into luxury living accommodation, with the challenge of an en-suite shower room and an outdoor space thrown in for good measure. What will Michelle and guest judge Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen make of the end results?

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermos most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant decor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows his 1930s Bradshaws guide to the unspoilt East Sussex port of Rye, where he learns about the loss of a generation of lifeboatmen in 1928. On the beaches at Rye, Michael explores one of 28,000 pillboxes constructed around the British coastline during the Second World War, before boarding the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch railway to Dungeness

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From the Kent Cinque Port of Deal, Michael Portillo heads to Walmer Castle, home during the 1920s to Lord Beauchamp, whose openly homosexual lifestyle led to his exile from the country. And in Margate, Michael discovers the connection to TS Eliot

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Herne Bay to Leeds Castle, Kent
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches the Kent seaside resort of Herne Bay, where he learns about a pioneering aviatrix who began her working life as a typist in Hull. In the seaside town of Whitstable, he tucks into its famous staple, oysters. Michael later crosses the North Downs to Lenham, and visits Leeds Castle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels in Greater London, beginning on its south-eastern fringe in the village of Chislehurst and ending up in Kennington to learn about the childhood of Charlie Chaplin

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: Adolf Hitler has his mind on making Germany into a great empire by expanding eastwards, but his invasion of Poland tips the world into a violent and bloody war

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: Betrayed, Stalin fights the German army in the Soviet states. The German occupation policies lead to the first extermination policies of undesirables

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: As Hitlers troops advance, occupants in Ukraine, Belarus and Poland take the brunt of the occupying forces cruelty; and the first concentration camps are created

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team takes on a modern day fast Ford to see if a quick flip could make a few quid and revisit a 3 year MG restoration project thats still not finished

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 90s Alfa with electrical issues lives up to its stereotype and the team revisit a road roller, four years on. They also tackle a French motoring icon, the Citroen 2CV6 Dolly

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Charlie head south for an immaculate Lotus Super 7. Derek and Jack are in Sheffield collecting a 1929 Riley Monaco and a 1924 Alvis 12/50 tourer

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will Trickett and Gus Gregory head to the West Country to buy a Golf GTI. Gus hates it on sight, but Will is smitten. They soon discover why the car is laid up - it has no engine

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the worlds most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the oceans edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon voyages across the Coral Triangle, a huge wilderness of tropical seas and jungle clad islands in the south-western Pacific, surrounded by the Philippines, Malaysia and Indonesia. It is one of the most beautiful and biodiverse corners of the words oceans and is crucial to the health of the wider marine environment, having been described as the Amazon of the seas

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will Trickett and Gus Gregory head to the West Country to buy a Golf GTI. Gus hates it on sight, but Will is smitten. They soon discover why the car is laid up - it has no engine

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Charlie head south for an immaculate Lotus Super 7. Derek and Jack are in Sheffield collecting a 1929 Riley Monaco and a 1924 Alvis 12/50 tourer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team purchase a 1950s Austin Westminster rally car in the hope that seasoned competitor Dave Mathewson can win a race

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A rare Reliant Scimitar GTC undergoes an expert recommission that leaves no bolt unturned, and a Honda CBR superbike from the 1980s needs a repair

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team are on the hunt to restore one of the greatest names in motoring history - the Bugatti. But with a strict budget they settle for a replica

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team takes on a modern day fast Ford to see if a quick flip could make a few quid and revisit a 3 year MG restoration project thats still not finished

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 90s Alfa with electrical issues lives up to its stereotype and the team revisit a road roller, four years on. They also tackle a French motoring icon, the Citroen 2CV6 Dolly

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Chichester, West Sussex, where he encounters an Edwardian motoring duo patronised by King Edward VII. After a grand tour of their factory, he is treated to some rest and relaxation in one of their finest vehicles. Arriving in the resort of Southsea, Hampshire, Michael heads for the Kings Theatre, where he treads the boards in a community production of Lads in the Village. Crossing the Solent, the presenter boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage, then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from the coalfields of South Wales to the southernmost tip of Cornwall, travelling from Whitland, Carmarthenshire, to Swansea

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Pontyclun to Ebbw Vale in Wales. Along the way, he visits the Royal Mint in Llantrisant and Cardiff Arms Park, scene of the first Welsh victory over the All Blacks back in 1905. In Cardiff Bay, Michael discovers the departure point for one of the Edwardian eras most famous expeditions - Scotts ill-fated voyage to the Antarctic

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads off to collect some vintage motorcycles from a garage at the bottom of the garden in the North-East of England

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Derek has his work cut out trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting the garage roof. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary examining how Hitler and the Nazi party rose to power in Germany during the 1930s, revealing the greed, manipulation and frightening underestimation of Adolf Hitlers ambition. In 1930, Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law, but just four years later its leader was a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. Leading historians and experts take viewers inside the minds of those hellbent on gaining power and those who tried to stop them. First broadcast in 1997

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: In Kursk, a battlefield the size of Wales, the tide turns, and the Soviets push back, but as Germany retreats, they destroy all evidence of their genocidal activities

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Belton House in Lincolnshire. Items include a ceramic model of London Zoos first elephant from the late 19th century, an engraved glass vase won at a fair in the 1920s, a collection of memorabilia relating to the Duke of Windsor and a childrens chair in the shape of a starfish. Theres also an interview with Professor Timon Screech about Britains centuries of trade with Japan, accompanied by an ornate lacquer chest that may have arrived with the first shipment of Japanese treasures in 1614

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team find a few treasures at Lowther Castle in Cumbria, including a 19th-century toy steamboat, a saucy illustration by English artist Lawson Wood, a lipstick and compact set evoking the glamour of 1920s Manhattan, and a rare letter providing a first-hand account of the 1916 Easter Rising in Ireland. Theres also another chance to meet Bess, a stuffed dog with an aristocratic pedigree first featured on the show in 2011

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team invest in a piece of French art this week - a 1971 Citroen DS21 Pallas

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Derek picks out a super low mileage MGC and the team pays a little too much to secure it

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis

In 1930, Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law, but just four years later its leader was a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: In Kursk, a battlefield the size of Wales, the tide turns, and the Soviets push back, but as Germany retreats, they destroy all evidence of their genocidal activities

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Tropic of Cancer with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The third leg of Simons journey takes him from the banks of the Nile to the edge of the Indian Ocean in Oman. Along the way he is introduced to Nubians displaced by the formation of Lake Nasser in the 1960s and nomadic Bedouins who have been forced to move by a seven-year drought scientists believe is due to climate change. On Egypts southern coast, he dives in pristine coral reefs, before seeing the unexpected sides of Saudi Arabian life

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Adventurer Simon Reeve sets out to travel around the coastline of the Indian Ocean, journeying by boat, car, train and plane as he takes in 16 countries. He starts on the tip of South Africa, where he dives with ragged-tooth sharks and joins conservationists helping to save the endangered African penguin, before heading into Cape Town, where he has a close encounter with a drug dealer. Moving on, he hitches a boat to Mozambique, where a nervous captain reveals the threat posed by Somali pirates, and completes this leg of his journey in Zanzibar, a tropical island steeped in the long history of the slave trade

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the Russian Revolution, adventurer Simon Reeve embarks on a journey across the worlds biggest country. He begins in Russias far east, and the snow-capped volcanoes of Kamchatka and Yakutia, where reindeer herders live in temperatures as low as minus 30. Outside the eastern port of Vladivostok, Simon investigates the growing influence of China on the area, then passes through the Boreal Forest, where he meets a conservationist dedicated to protecting the Amur tiger. His final destination is a giant hole in the ground in Siberia

With Jims suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clares boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deenas best friend Sally? Henry Blofeld is keen to find a cure for an old injury, so he and Paul Chuckle visit a local hospital where western medicine is combined with yoga. programme.desc: James and David struggle with an unrealistic seller, while Tracy decides to list her own home. Flagg and Altmans launch event for their listing turns sour

programme.title: John Gilligan: The End of the Line
programme.desc: Notorious criminal John Gilligan was arrested on the Costa Blanca in a joint operation involving Gardai and Spanish Police. Once considered one of Irelands most successful drug barons, the 68-year-old is now suspected of running a drug trafficking operation from Spain. This documentary delves into the history of John Gilligans life of crime, his 25-year battle with the Criminal Assets Bureau and his futile attempt to re-establish himself as a player in the international drug trade

programme.desc: Danny Dyer travels the country exploring the contentious subject of modern masculinity, questioning whether men have lost their sense of identity and what it means to be male in 21st-century Britain. Along the way, he tries to get to the bottom of toxic masculinity and find out why so many young men are struggling with their mental health and relationships with women. Danny sets out to find out whether theres a rise in toxic masculinity in society and, if there is, why? He meets up with his brother Tony, before tackling controversial influencer Ed Matthews, meeting teenage boys at a London school, and speaking with Mansfield MP Ben Bradley, whos a champion of mens issues. He also meets male victims of domestic abuse, and in Brighton, he chats to members of the Brighton Gay Mens Chorus about overcoming prejudice

Still riding in the Navajo Nation, the bikers stop at Tsaile College to learn more about rodeo and cook a lamb stew with corn dumplings in homage of the Navajo people they met

When mild-mannered nurse Malcolm (Reece Shearsmith) is confronted by his new wife over his wild spending, he starts to drug her to keep her quiet. However, a medical check-up then threatens to expose him, so he decides to silence his spouse once and for all. Three years on, he has a new bride - and history appears to be repeating itself. With Sheridan Smith and Kate Fleetwood

David Jason stars, with Billy Murray and James Hayes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate the murder of an ex-army recluse and archaeological enthusiast and suspect a building dispute could provide a motive, while Dennis asks Liz for advice when he begins to notice a change in Jennys behaviour. Vernon decides to play Cupid on behalf of his relative Gareth and sets him up on a blind date with Rosie, but does not count on the mechanic having another admirer. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Aislin McGuckin and Vanessa Hehir

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross is given hope for the Despards return to Honduras, but finds his new arch enemy Ralph Hanson has returned to Truro. Dwight gains unexpected patients, though his absences from home have unforeseen consequences, and Morwenna starts to slip away from the village in secret. Ralph enlists Tess and disgruntled locals to set a plot in motion to undo the Despards and the Poldarks

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody and Dylan deny any involvement in the hit-and-run, Kit warns Carla about Costello, and Todd and Theo move into the corner shop flat

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody and Dylan deny any involvement in the hit-and-run, Kit warns Carla about Costello, and Todd and Theo move into the corner shop flat

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Its Vinny and Gabbys big day and while Moira and Ross are intrigued, Liam is embarrassed

programme.title: Bodyguard
programme.desc: Julias counter-terrorism bill draws even closer to becoming law while London is left reeling from the recent attacks. However, her ambitions stir up political rivalries, leaving David under even greater pressure to ensure her safety. The police are marginalised from the investigation into the terrorist attacks, which is placed under the control of the security service, and David is left unsure who to trust as his superiors put pressure on him to provide them with information on Julias activities

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Killian, Shivanni and Ishmail take part in the game show hosted by Ian Wright, answering questions to try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. The money up for grabs continues to climb but so does the pressure as one final ball needs to be played - the Moneyball - that could see a player leaving with their hard-earned prize or going home with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Tipping Point

programme.title: Wild Britain
programme.desc: Cameras follow some of the animals that thrive in inner-city environments across the country. Urban foxes did not exist in Britain until the 1930s, but now these animals inhabit 90% of towns and cities and take residence in built-up living quarters. Meanwhile, cameras observe families of hedgehogs thriving in unkempt gardens, and peregrine falcons nesting in some on Londons tallest buildings

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: DJ Mike Read puts on a dinner party at his Oxfordshire home for four dinner guests as he plays mystery celebrity host. Will they need to take host Brian McFaddens Poptastic bonus to guess Reads identity?

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: A driver raises the alarm when he suspects that his train has hit something - or someone - on the line, while heavy rain brings down a tree which closes the tracks between Banbury and Oxford. Plus, engineers begin the process of dismantling a Victorian viaduct

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie helps Maureen and John, who have an overflowing storage unit after downsizing to their latest home. Plus, she travels to Birmingham to meet David, who is struggling to tackle the seven-year problem of sorting out his parents cluttered house - and matters come to a head with an unexpected proposition

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden invites Team Fitness to guess the identity of another celebrity host, this time in the form of Steps star Ian H Watkins

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Michelin-starred chef Matt Gillan puts four home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make mushrooms on toast. Hosted by Sheree Murphy

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a pug-terrier cross who has been badly injured in an accident involving a car, and a 10-month-old bulldog recovering from airway surgery. Elsewhere, Paul bumps into Jennifer Saunders, one of Batterseas famous volunteers, who like Paul, struggles to fight the urge to adopt all the dogs at the shelter

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul dons protective clothing to help with treatments on 11-week-old Humphrey, a Bedlington Terrier suffering from ringworm, which include medicated baths. As he helps with his treatments, his head is turned by the small pup, who is struggling to stop scratching himself. Elsewhere, he also joins head vet Shaun on the streets as he does his rounds treating dogs belonging to Londons homeless people, and meets a six-month-old golden retriever that was found tied to a railing and is in need of some serious training

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The final stage of Fred Sirieixs gastronomic tour takes him to Derry during the Halloween festival where he dances his way through the parade and explores the arboretum and BBQ school at Brook Hall. He also tackles a cycling challenge to the village of Muff in nearby County Donegal and meets Mickey Bradley from the Undertones

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony-winning actor Viola Davis, star of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 Will Poulter and renowned comedian Jack Dee. Plus, a performance from Simple Minds of their iconic hit Dont You (Forget About Me) ahead of the songs 40th anniversary

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by Irish actor and singer Jessie Buckley, starring in Charlie Kaufmans Netflix drama Im Thinking of Ending Things. Also appearing are comedian Bill Bailey - one of this years Strictly contestants - plus fellow comic and childrens author David Walliams. Singer Dermot Kennedy performs his single Giants, and the host offers a wry look at some trending news stories

programme.title: Harry and Meghan: Is America Turning Against Them?
programme.desc: A look at whether the Duke and Duchess of Sussexs popularity in the United States is on the wane amid heavy criticism and parody that has been levelled at them. At one point they were the darlings of LA and indeed America, with mega money deals, podcasts and exclusive TV appearances galore, but the tide appears to have turned, and the once enthralled American publics interest is waning
